title: Is this the world we created? - Quora

response.answer_text: Nope! It's the world our ancestors created, and they aren't us. It's horrible, beautiful, honest, unfair, infinite, finite, brutal, nurturing, and yours to improve. The people complaining about how unfair the patriarchy is are foolish, as “the patriarchy” is the only thing keeping them from freezing to death each night. The people proud that “our white anglo-saxon forefathers built this world” are also foolish, as they have done exactly nothing to deserve any credit for what others who happened to have similar skin colour have done. The world is tragic, wonderful, rank with evil and bursting with love. None of that was your fault, but the future is your responsibility.

Is this the world we created What did we do it for Is this the world we invaded Against the law So it seems in the end Is this what we’re all living for today The world we created Oh, sorry, was this not a question about the Queen song? The planet was created by natural forces at some point after the universe began. Much, much later, life (Monera, Protista, Fungi, Plantae and Animalia) got going and shaped the world over millions of years to what we see today - a process that is still going on and will continue long after puny humans go extinct.
